summary: TypeScript SDK should drop signals with unparseable payloads instead of failing, matching behavior in Go and Java SDKs. This prevents runtime errors when signal arguments cannot be deserialized.
userImpact: Currently, signals with unparseable payloads cause failures in the TypeScript SDK, whereas Go and Java SDKs gracefully drop them.
rootCause: TypeScript SDK does not implement signal payload deserialization failure handling that exists in Go and Java implementations.
proposedFix: Implement signal dropping behavior for failed payload deserialization to match Go and Java SDK behavior.
keyQuote: In Go and Java we drop signals whose args can't be deserialized, we should here too.
